dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Netflix, uh, just dropped their Q1 earnings, and it wasn't exactly stellar news, was it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Netflix, uh, just dropped their Q one earnings, and it wasn't exactly stellar news, was it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all, A. I mean, their subscriber growth was their lowest ever, like, just 9.6 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all, A. I mean, their subscriber growth was their lowest ever, like, just nine point six million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and most of that, what was it, 7.8 million, came from outside the US. Domestically, it's really slowing down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and most of that, what was it, seven point eight million, came from outside the U S. Domestically, it's really slowing down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Much of that growth—7.86 million subscribers—came outside the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then you have Reed Hastings, the CEO, coming out with these statements. He's trying to act like he's not sweating the new competition, but the numbers tell a different story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then you have Reed Hastings, the C E O, coming out with these statements. He's trying to act like he's not sweating the new competition, but the numbers tell a different story.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! He even said these "world-class" new brands, like Disney and Apple, wouldn't offer any benefit to consumers. Like, really? Star Wars isn't a benefit?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! He even said these world-class new brands, like Disney and Apple, wouldn't offer any benefit to consumers. Like, really? Star Wars isn't a benefit?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big dog of Internet TV acknowledged the new competitors as world-class consumer brands whose forthcoming services would be a boon to consumers and content creators alike.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] I know, right? It's wild! He's almost, uh, dismissing it as if the transition to on-demand is insignificant and their content is all identical anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It's wild! He's almost, uh, dismissing it as if the transition to on-demand is insignificant and their content is all identical anyway.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then he's also quoted saying there's "little demand for bad movies and TV shows," and Netflix already satisfies *all* of that demand. Talk about confidence!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then he's also quoted saying there's little demand for bad movies and T V shows, and Netflix already satisfies all of that demand. Talk about confidence!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He argued that theres ample appetite for great movies and TV shows, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps slightly] I mean, it's a weird kind of confidence, though, isn't it? Because he also acknowledged there's a "ton of competition out there," but then immediately pivoted to saying there are "very few competitors for entertainment time."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's a weird kind of confidence, though, isn't it? Because he also acknowledged there's a ton of competition out there, but then immediately pivoted to saying there are very few competitors for entertainment time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Theres a ton of competition out there, Hastings said in a recorded interview following the earnings release. ... But frankly, I doubt it will be material, because again theres so many competitors for entertainment time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: It's like he's trying to spin it both ways, uh, simultaneously. Meanwhile, revenue dropped 22%, and they had a net loss per share, way below analyst expectations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like he's trying to spin it both ways, uh, simultaneously. Meanwhile, revenue dropped twenty two percent, and they had a net loss per share, way below analyst expectations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Revenue for the first quarter rose 22% to $4.5 billion, compared with a year earlier. Netflix reported a net income of 76 cents a share, exceeding the estimates of Wall Street analysts, who had forecast per-share earnings of 57 cents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: And he's even downplaying their own successes! Like, *Umbrella Academy* did 45 million households, but he just kinda brushed it off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's even downplaying their own successes! Like, Umbrella Academy did forty five million households, but he just kinda brushed it off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the face of mounting competition, Hastings touted the strength of Netflix's original content. The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And ignoring local content too, like *Nailed It! Mexico*, which was actually doing really well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And ignoring local content too, like Nailed It! Mexico, which was actually doing really well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Netflix looks to expand its subscriber base outside the U.S., Hastings touted the service's local program offerings. It is adapting its lighthearted cooking competition Nailed It! for Mexico, France, Germany and Spain. ¡Nailed It!: México has achieved three times more first-month watchers in Mexico than the dubbed US version, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like they're trying to, uh, project strength when they're clearly feeling the heat. Especially with Disney+ rolling out with, like, all those huge franchises.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like they're trying to, uh, project strength when they're clearly feeling the heat. Especially with Disney plus rolling out with, like, all those huge franchises.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Which he called a "weak roster," mind you! Star Wars, Pixar, Marvel, "weak."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which he called a weak roster, mind you! Star Wars, Pixar, Marvel, weak.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The forthcoming service debuts in the U.S. on Nov. 12 with a strong roster of entertainment brands, including Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And then you have Ted Sarandos, their content chief, practically admitting their strategy is about "stealing" ideas or, uh, making "awful stories" because they don't own those big brands.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And then you have Ted Sarandos, their content chief, practically admitting their strategy is about stealing ideas or, uh, making awful stories because they don't own those big brands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos. So increasingly our business is about creating and telling great stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the big dog of streaming is, like, cornered a bit, trying to put on a brave face while the landscape completely changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the big dog of streaming is, like, cornered a bit, trying to put on a brave face while the landscape completely changes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: It's gonna be a really interesting next few quarters, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's gonna be a really interesting next few quarters, that's for sure.
